alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 8:53PM CDT until March 27 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties. Spring River At Imboden affecting Lawrence and Randolph Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Serious flooding in Fulton and Sharp counties along the river. Dangerous situation with swift water running through campground and under homes along the river. September 2006 flood crested at 16.8 feet. Life threatening situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 15.5 feet early Saturday morning, March 25. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 4.4 Thu 8 PM 13.3 9.9 5.9 15.5 1 AM 3/25 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
